description: A Medieval Latin transcription of the Arabic بَهْمَن‎ (bahman).

definitionGroups.group: (obsolete) Any of various plants imported into Europe for the pharmaceutical trade in dried form, so of uncertain identity.

entries.meaning: Behen rubrum or red behen: said in some sources to be Salvia haematodes (now Salvia pratensis subsp. haematodes), but in other sources to be Statice limonium, which is a synonym for Limonium vulgare.
examples: The roots and seed of red Behen are Styptic, or Restringent  […]

entries.meaning: Behen album or white behen: a thistle native to western and central Asia, Centaurea behen
examples: White Behen is referred by all writers on materia medica to Centaurea Behen L., a plant of Persia and traditionally also of the Lebanon.

entries.meaning: Behen officinarum: Cucubalis behen or Oberna behen, synonyms for Silene vulgaris
